title: How to quickly distinguish an educated Brit from totally an ignorant one, because that's not always obvious or easy - Quora

response.answer_text: Not really sure you can. An undergraduate degree or a PHD or any kind of diploma doesn’t really give any indication on how much a person is educated. I have no idea how Black holes exist but I can easily tell you the difference between polyrhythms and polymetrics. I’m not great with how inserting new DNA into plant cells can create an entirely different species but I know almost every capital of every sovereign nation in the world simply because I’ve put the work in. How do you distinguish? Ask them.

Harsh. ‘Because that’s not always obvious or easy …’ any other nationality that would be xenophobic, the word is British. Just because a person is educated doesn’t mean they cannot be ignorant in the sense of being discourteous or rude. A poorly or incompletely educated person is perfectly capable of of being courteous and respectful. Let’s rephrase the question: How can I quickly distinguish an ignorant British person from one who is not? Simple, as with any other nationality, as soon as they open their mouth and come out with disrespectful rubbish. Or How can I quickly distinguish an educated British person from one who is not? Why? So you can establish your social status? It doesn’t work like that here in the UK, we treat each other with respect, unless you are a twat of course.

While we are discussing those ignorant Brits, let me help you out: It should be “… from a totally ignorant one.. “ not “…. from totally an ignorant one… “ The comma after “one” is unnecessary. You should not really say “that's not always obvious or easy”. It is a clumsy construction. It is not clear whether you mean that the difference is not obvious or the method of distinguishing is not obvious. Finally, for your future reference: ignorance is often betrayed in the questions one asks.

If you’re talking of general ignorance as opposed to a lack of education then you’ll find wealthier, more educated, better educated people have good teeth on the whole. Poorer, less educated , lower on the social scale people tend to have bad teeth.A sad but true fact is that wealthier people have better access to education and healthcare on the whole. Teeth are a good indicator of a good upbringing and being able to afford private dentistry. Just my observations on life☺☺

By using the word Brit you must be American and referring to English people, or do you include the Scots, Welsh, Irish, Manx, Hebredian, Cornish, West Indians, Australians, New Zealander's, Indians, Pakistani, Hong Kongians, Channel Islanders, Gibraltarians, Falklanders, British Crown Dependents, etc, etc, all of whom are some of the people currently residing in these British Isles and may be termed as Brits ?
The gifts that education provide to individuals is the subjective perspectives. So a person who jumps to conclusions quickly must not be your man. But the one who asks you a question ?

Talk to the person but be aware that qualifications doesn't mean intelligent. The best read man I have ever met was a labourer and most highly educated fool I have met, attended a very famous public school and then went to Oxford.
